original_title: Supreme Court delivers determination on ‘Central Bank of Sri Lanka Bill’
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); Sri Lanka's Supreme Court has determined that none of the provisions in the Central Bank of Sri Lanka Bill are inconsistent with the Constitution.
The announcement was made to the Parliament by the Speaker on Tuesday (4).
The Supreme Court in its determination noted that the Bill can be passed by a simple majority in Parliament, subject to the amendments mentioned in the determination sent to the speaker.
The determination of the Supreme Court on the Central Bank of Sri Lanka Bill seen by News 1st comprises of 54 pages.
